results.title: The Lavender Hill Mob
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
This comedy stars Alec Guinness as an underpaid bank clerk who plans and executes a gold robbery but his colleagues’ attempt to hide the loot leads to bizarre and suspenseful complications. Also features Stanley Holloway and Sidney James. Won Academy award for Best story and screenplay.

results.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A genteel mass-murderer is out to heartlessly eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and the family fortune. Alec Guinness plays all eight victims in this witty black comedy. Based on the novel “Noblesse oblige” by Roy Horniman.

results.title: The Knock at the door
results.creator_credit: Helen Raw, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: War has followed Helen all her life. As a young girl, she wrote letters to her brothers overseas and she had feared losing her husband in the Vietnam war. That dreaded knock on the door was something she never wanted to hear.

results.title: Washing machine [caveman]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. A caveman’s chase of a dinosaur is interrupted by his curiosity for a mysterious object in the landscape, a washing machine. He fiddles with and bashes the washing machine in an attempt to work out what it is and discovers its’ function, a ‘drinking fountain’ (pre-historic term unknown).

results.title: Join the navy and see the world they say
results.creator_credit: Ron Baguley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Inspired by his childhood hero, ‘Uncle Jack’, Ron Baguley enlisted in the Navy at the ripe age of 16. “Join the Navy and see the world they say!” In 1952, Ron was plucked from his job as a carpenter and thrown into a life at sea, serving initially in the Korean Conflict. Ron tracks his incredibly journey from a young recruit to a senior warrant officer.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Baguley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: An interview with Cyril Sayles
results.brief_description: At the age of 16, Cyril Sayles, not wanting to continue his manual labour in the mines, decided to join the army. Having lied about his age, he had a special made uniform and was off to fight the Germans in World War II. Cyril humorously shares his story of strength and courage, through his battle and imprisonment during the war.

results.title: A Boy called "Rabbit"
results.creator_credit: Ken Cumming, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Cumming’s dearest memory of the time he served in Vietnam was a young boy by the name of “Rabbit”. While “Rabbit” couldn’t speak English, he was popular with the Australian soldiers for his fast running and bravery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Cumming, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Ladykillers [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: This film is an extract from the film directed by Alexander Mackendrick which includes stars such as Alec Guinness, Cecil Parker, Herbert Lom, Peter Sellers, Frankie Howerd and others. The Professor (Alec Guiness) is making a last minute check on the bank’s procedure for transferring money while the rest of the gang are still at Mrs. Wilberforce’s keeping up the pretence that they are musicians at rehearsal…then working with military precision and split-second timing the gang successfully effect the robbery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.description: This film is an extract from the film directed by Alexander Mackendrick which includes stars such as Alec Guinness, Cecil Parker, Herbert Lom, Peter Sellers, Frankie Howerd and others. results.title: Pharmaceutical girl
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Parker, David Atkinson and Dik Jarman
results.brief_description: ‘Pharmaceutical girl’ is not strictly a claymation. The creator Dik Jarman with Nick Pledge set about experimenting with an alternate type of puppet. Pledge created an internal armitage complete with moving joints and rising chest cavity, whilst Jarman designed and sculpted the puppet using an alternate latex type of skin to form the flesh of the puppet. A surreal animation that takes us on the journey of Sukei and her addiction. Dealt mostly with symbolism, the pricks of the rose replace the syringe. The set (of which Jarman won an award for) is both functional for the purpose of shooting scenes with moveable walls etc, but also represents Sukei’s mind as the greater part of the set makes up the internals of a clock. As she begins to hallucinate the clock-like set begins to grind to a halt and then into reverse, Sukei’s dream takes over. What initially begins as peaceful escape quickly turns into a nightmare. (The soundtrack is by Edwina Blush and Thierry Cotco Lovett).
